intro: Pimelea speciosa, commonly known as the showy everlasting or mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Pimelea speciosa is known for its long-lasting flowers, which retain their color and form even when dried.
